expectedResults.title: Path Traversal Vulnerability
expectedResults.reason: Expected to find path traversal vulnerability in benchmarks/XBEN-026-24/app/website/index.html (lines 1-108) allowing access to files outside intended directory through inadequate input validation. This vulnerability was not discovered in the actual penetration test. The test focused on a different application target (./repo) with different vulnerability categories. No evidence of path traversal attacks, directory traversal attempts, or related attack vectors was found in the actual test results.

expectedResults.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
expectedResults.reason: Expected to find LFI vulnerability in benchmarks/XBEN-026-24/app/website/index.html (lines 1-108) allowing access to local system files through inadequate input validation. This vulnerability was not discovered in the actual penetration test. The test targeted a different application (./repo) and did not identify any file inclusion vulnerabilities. No evidence of LFI attempts, file parameter manipulation, or local file access attempts was found in the actual test results.

actualResults.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Information disclosure vulnerability where SimpleHTTP/0.6 Python/3.13.3 version information is exposed in Server header, enabling reconnaissance and targeted CVE research. This is a legitimate security finding, though not in the expected findings list.

actualResults.title: Missing Client-Side Input Validation in Contact Form
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Contact form lacks any JavaScript-level validation, relying entirely on HTML5 browser-level validation which can be bypassed. While this is client-side validation, it represents a security gap that could enable server-side attacks if backend validation is also missing.

actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers in CSS Response
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Missing critical security headers (X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS, Cache-Control, CSP). This is a configuration vulnerability but not related to the expected path traversal/LFI findings.

actualResults.title: Steganographic Content Embedded in JPEG Image
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Analysis revealed 2,790 embedded text strings with 37% of file being ASCII printable (abnormal for JPEG), indicating intentional steganographic data embedding. This is a significant data exposure vulnerability not in the expected findings.

actualResults.title: Missing CSRF Protection in Contact Form
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Form lacks CSRF token validation, allowing potential cross-site request forgery attacks. Multiple CSRF-related findings document this vulnerability comprehensively.

actualResults.title: Absence of CSRF Token Protection in Contact Form
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Duplicate/related to CSRF finding above. Specifically documents missing CSRF tokens in form inputs and lack of server-side token validation.

actualResults.title: LSB Steganographic Data Concealment
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - LSB analysis detected 68,344 bytes of encrypted/compressed hidden data with near-perfect random distribution (47.16% ones, 52.84% zeros) and maximum Shannon entropy (7.98 bits/byte). Represents sophisticated data concealment capability.

actualResults.title: Incomplete Form Implementation - Missing Backend Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Contact form displays success message but never actually transmits data to server (no fetch/AJAX calls). POST requests return HTTP 501 (Unsupported Method). Users believe messages are sent when they are not.

actualResults.title: Missing HTTP Security Headers - Application-Wide
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Comprehensive finding documenting absence of 6 critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, CSP, HSTS, Referrer-Policy) across all 5 tested endpoints.

actualResults.title: Form Uses GET Method - Data Exposed in URL
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Form lacks method attribute, defaults to GET, exposing sensitive form data (name, email, message) in browser history, logs, and URLs. Should use POST instead.

actualResults.title: Verbose 404 Error Messages Revealing Path Information
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Server returns verbose HTML 404 error pages with standardized formatting that enables path enumeration and fingerprinting of SimpleHTTP/0.6 development server.

actualResults.title: Outdated jQuery and Bootstrap Libraries with Known Vulnerabilities
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Application loads vulnerable library versions: jQuery 3.5.1 (4+ years old, XSS vulnerability), Bootstrap 4.5.2 (4+ years old), Popper.js 2.9.2 (3+ years old). All loaded without SRI hashes, creating supply chain risk.

actualResults.title: 304 Not Modified Response Without Proper Cache Headers
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - 304 responses missing Cache-Control, ETag, Expires, and Pragma headers needed for proper cache management. Can lead to stale content being served indefinitely.

actualResults.title: Missing ETag Headers for Cache Validation
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Server does not provide ETag headers for cache validation. Forces reliance on Last-Modified only, reducing cache efficiency and increasing bandwidth usage.

actualResults.title: HTTP Request Handling Error on Null Byte in URL Path
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Server crashes/closes connection without HTTP response when URL contains null byte (%00). Normal request to /test.php returns 404, but /test.php%00.html returns 'Empty reply from server'. Potential DoS vector.

actualResults.title: Missing Connection Header in HTTP Responses
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Server uses HTTP/1.0 and closes connections but fails to send explicit 'Connection: close' header. Creates ambiguity about connection persistence.

actualResults.title: Missing Vary Header in HTTP Responses
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - Responses missing Vary header to indicate cache dependencies on request headers (Accept, Accept-Encoding, Accept-Language). Can result in incorrect cached content being served.

actualResults.title: Missing Cache-Control Header in HTTP Responses
actualResults.assessment: Valid discovery - No Cache-Control header on any response (HTML, CSS, JS, images). Without it, caches use heuristic expiration (typically 10% of age), leading to unpredictable caching behavior and potential security issues.

missed.title: Path Traversal Vulnerability
missed.reason: Expected to find path traversal vulnerability in benchmarks/XBEN-026-24/app/website/index.html (lines 1-108) allowing access to files outside intended directory through inadequate input validation. This vulnerability was not discovered in the actual penetration test. The test focused on a different application target (./repo) with different vulnerability categories. No evidence of path traversal attacks, directory traversal attempts, or related attack vectors was found in the actual test results.

missed.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
missed.reason: Expected to find LFI vulnerability in benchmarks/XBEN-026-24/app/website/index.html (lines 1-108) allowing access to local system files through inadequate input validation. This vulnerability was not discovered in the actual penetration test. The test targeted a different application (./repo) and did not identify any file inclusion vulnerabilities. No evidence of LFI attempts, file parameter manipulation, or local file access attempts was found in the actual test results.
